note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Next generation plugin of Piece by Piece
body:
### Requirement
===============
Windows XP/Vista/7
.NET Framework 3.5

### Installation
===============
#### Install DevExpress dll
![1](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/1.png)
![2](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/2.png)
Move dlls into C:\Windows\assembly. Notice: it has 8 dlls.
![3](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/3.png)
That's map chart control.

#### Deploy Parameter Files::NPxP Config
![4](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/4.png)
Copy all folder to `C:\Program Files\Web Ranger\Parameter Files\`
Those config might not appropriate for your project, but next step will
help you setup this. You just copy that.
Check the `NPxP` folder has `system`,`grade`,`map` folders.

#### Install plugin
![5](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/5.png)
![6](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/6.png)
PlugIns has three folders, that vaersion `2.7.3` , `2.8.x+`, `Others`

##### 2.7.3
----- 
only support Web Inspector 2.7.3. that is not append xml of config into database. but fixed memory issue, and other bug issue.

###### 2.8.x+
It's fixed current all issue. but not test with machine in production environment.

###### Others
The folder has some dll that for backup.
System occur crush in XP sometime that cause RT and NPxP config broke.
If you encounter this situation please check all config files.(Parameter Files) and use dlls.

###### Notes
In 2.7.3 version necessary a `C:\temp` folder that debug tool for log of exception.
If you can't open software that show all empty on map please check that folder exists.
![7](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/7.png)

### Launch
===============
![8](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/8.png)
When you first start Web Inspector with NPxP Plugin . You should set some config in debug mode.
That press `Ctrl + d` to open debug mode. and turn off the default Flawmap.
![9](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/9.png)
That's done. You can see screen as follow :
![10](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/10.png)


### Quick Setup
===============
![11](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/11.png)
Switch tab to `Queue` and load your job (mcs).
then click `Map Setting` button to open window.
![12](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/12.png)
Click save. that's done.

This step for load your defect data into map config.

### Usage::Detail
===============
#### Map Setting
-------------------
The map setting is for config map ex: shape, color.

![13](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/13.png)
Start `Web Inspector` and switch tab to `Queue`
Click `Edit` job to config for NPxP. 

![14](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/14.png)
The NPxP Plugin need some piece data from this.
So it checked and enter width and height of Piece.

![15](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/15.png)
Click `Load Next` job that help NPxP Plugin get defect and piece data.

![16](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/16.png)
Click `Map Setting` open the setup window, You can setup your preferences here for map.
If you first time use NPxP Plugin, even if doesn't edit anything , you should click `save` .
 
![17](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/17.png)
Double click on cell then open color setup dialog. 

![18](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/18.png)
Check your preferences and save then should see success message.

![19](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/19.png)
The legend can help you hide or show defect on map

![20](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/20.png)
The shape is show your preferences.

#### Grade Setting
------------------
The Grade is a custom scoring mechanism.

##### ROI Setting
![21](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/21.png)
The first step you should config grid's columns and rows.
Then click `Create`

![22](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/22.png)
Set each grid size. Notice your unit that follow job.

##### Grade Setting
![23](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/23.png)
Switch to `Grade Setting Tab` and sub tab `Point` is mean your defect.
You can set each defect score.

![24](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/24.png)
Notice each grid has score own. If you want to set once for all grid(sub piece). Please select `All` and checked `Same value from [All] tag`

![25](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/25.png)
Each grid(sub piece) has a score that can get a level. According this level and score list.
You can set A-E and assign a score. example: A:10 B:20 when grid get 15 that level is A.
Other score belongs to F(ail).

![26](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/26.png)
Pass or Fail Score is define a piece will send what event. A-F
Again according this list, All grid(sub piece)'s total score will get a level (Event).
Now all config is done.

#### Start Inspect
![27](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/27.png)
Click `Start` to start inspect.

![28](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/28.png)
Top area will show about pass number , fail number, yield, and Total Score of this piece.

![29](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/29.png)
Click `Fail Piece List` to open window that show all fail piece 

![30](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/30.png)
Click the row will switch to that fail piece

![31](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/31.png)
The legend list help you show just you want to see.
![32](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/32.png)

![33](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/33.png)
Click the right table's tab will selection a defect and `GridView` selection realtime.
![34](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/34.png)

![35](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/35.png)
You can change pieces by `Prev` or `Next` button.

![36](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/36.png)
Double click will show the defect detail information.
![37](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/37.png)
![38](http://www.winspection.com/npxp/38.png)
You can Zoom in out this image of defect.
name: NPxP
